column4: Review of civil service pay structures and terms and conditions
column7: The work supports the review announced on 24 May and requires detailed knowledge of individual civil service labour markets, and private sector pay conditions, around the country and the application of that knowledge to produce deliverables in time to meet the project deadlines. This specialist knowledge is not readily available in government

The work will identify gaps in knowledge of sustainable procurement across procurement professionals in central government.  The Department does not have the necessary specialist skills to undertake the work in-house.

column4: Legal Support for ERG Contract Renegotiation Stream
column7: In support of the Government's drive to reduce public expenditure with third party suppliers, high level strategic legal advice is required on both specific contract savings where large scale savings can be achieved and on future activities to improve existing contracts and to support wider reforms to the commissioning and procurement of services provided to citizens.
Independent expert advice is required for the Graham Allen  review of Early Years Intervention Delivery and contributing to the report.
